question: 真似
sourceMnemonic: You're taking <kanji>reality</kanji> and trying to <kanji>resemble</kanji> it. To do this, you have to do an <vocabulary>impersonation</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>mimicry</vocabulary>, or an <vocabulary>imitation</vocabulary>,.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This word uses the kun'yomi reading for <ja>真</ja> and an irregular reading for <ja>似</ja>. You've already learned the reading for <ja>真</ja>, but here's a mnemonic to help you with <ja>似</ja>:

What are you impersonating? A horse! You gallop around <reading>neigh</reading>ing (<ja>ね</ja>) at the top of your lungs! That's a pretty good imitation.
